attributes.action: begin regular testing for prostate cancer in men between the ages of 40 and 70
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Prostate cancer is the largest cause of male deaths. A blood test, known as PSA, can indicate that there is a problem that needs investigating. In the Tryol district of Austria this is being done and the mortality rates have fallen. Too many men are being diagnosed only when it is too late for treatment to be more than palliative.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "begin regular testing for prostate cancer in men between the ages of 40 and 70."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page13021.asp

Prime Minister's Office
